article.title: List of the Dead Sea Scrolls
article.text:
{{Infobox artifact | name = List of the Dead Sea Scrolls | image = [[File:Temple Scroll.png|250px]] | image2 = | image_caption = A view of part of the [[Temple Scroll]] that was found in Qumran Cave 11. | material = [[Papyrus]], Parchment, and [[Bronze]] | size = | writing = [[Hebrew language|Hebrew]], [[Aramaic language|Aramaic]], [[Greek language|Greek]], and [[Nabataean Aramaic|Nabataean]] | created = Est. 408 BCE to 318 CE | discovered = 1946/7 - 1956 | location = Various | id = }} A list of the [[Dead Sea Scrolls]], a collection of [[manuscript]]s discovered between 1946 and 1956 in the [[West Bank]] near the [[Dead Sea]]. The following is a '''list of the Dead Sea Scrolls''' from the [[The Qumran Caves|caves]] near Qumran: ==The Dead Sea Scrolls== Information is not always comprehensive, as content for many scrolls has not yet been fully published. Some resources for more complete information on the scrolls are the book by [[Emanuel Tov]], "Revised Lists of the Texts from the Judaean Desert"{{Cite book|title = Revised Lists of the Texts from the Judaean Desert|last = Tov|first = Emanuel|publisher = Brill|year = 2010|isbn = 9789047443797|location = |pages = }} for a complete list of all of the Dead Sea Scroll texts, as well as the online webpages for the [[Shrine of the Book]]{{cite web|url = http://dss.collections.imj.org.il|title = Shrine Of The Book - The Digital Dead Sea Scrolls|date = |accessdate = |website = |publisher = |last = |first = }} and the Leon Levy Collection, both of which present photographs and images of the scrolls and fragments themselves for closer study. {|class="wikitable plainrowheaders; min-width:75%" |- !
